SENT.plain: A retrospective survey of 38 cases of Moyamoya disease was done
The majority of patients were adults, and Chinese
There was a relative paucity of juveniles in our series which appear to differentiate it from Japanese results
The majority of adults presented with either subarachnoid haemorrhage or motor paresis
Associated aneurysms were noted in 3 cases

This study represents one of the largest series of this condition published outside Japan and appears to confirm the belief that this is not a condition peculiar to the Japanese and may occur more commonly outside Japan than is commonly believed
